revised_title: Seismic Investigations on the Palaeozoic Floor of East England
tldr: This study investigates the depth of the Palaeozoic floor under part of East England using the refraction seismic method. The authors collected data from bore-holes and outcrops, creating contoured maps showing the depths of various horizons and the thicknesses of rock between them. They also provide a map of the Palaeozoic floor's shape and discuss its composition based on re-examined bore-hole cores and seismic velocities.
